tit.e: Decorated Tombs (decorated tumulus by pictures, patterns and engravings)
Decorated Tombs (decorated tumulus by pictures, patterns and engravings)

sen.j: 装飾古墳（そうしょくこふん）とは、内部の壁や石棺に絵画、文様、彫刻などの装飾のある古墳の総称で、墳丘を持たない横穴墓も含まれる。
sen.e: Soshoku kofun is a general term for the tumulus which has decorations such as pictures, patterns and engravings on the interior wall or the stone coffin and it includes Yokoanabo cave tombs (tunnel graves) which has no tumulus.
sen.cmt: 「横穴墓」を、Yokoanabo cave tombs (tunnel graves)としました。
sen.e: Decorated tombs are a general term for the decorated tumulus by pictures, patterns and engravings on the interior wall or the stone coffin and it includes Yokoanabo cave tombs (tunnel graves) which has no mound.

Decorated tombs are a general term for the decorated tumulus by pictures, patterns and engravings on the interior wall or the stone coffin and it includes Yokoanabo cave tombs (tunnel graves) which has no mound.

sen.j: 大半が九州地方、特に熊本県に集中している。
sen.e: Most of them center on Kyushu region, especially in Kumamoto Prefecture.
Most of them center on Kyushu region, especially in Kumamoto Prefecture.
Most of them center on Kyushu region, especially in Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 熊本県山鹿市のチブサン古墳などが有名である。
sen.e: Chibuzan Tomb in Yamaga City, Kumamoto Prefecture and so on is famous.
Chibuzan-kofun Tumulus in Yamaga City, Kumamoto Prefecture and others are famous.
Chibuzan-kofun Tumulus in Yamaga City, Kumamoto Prefecture and others are famous.

tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 装飾古墳の分布については、全国に600ぐらいあり、その半数以上に当たる340基が九州地方に、100基が関東地方に、50基が山陰地方に、40基が近畿地方に、約40基が東北地方にあり、その他は7県に点在している。
sen.e: As for the distribution of soshoku kofun, there are six hundred ones across Japan and 340 ones, more than half of them, are in Kyushu region, 100 ones in Kanto region, 50 ones in Sanin region, 40 ones in Kinki region, about 40 ones in Tohoku region and the others are sparsely in seven Prefectures.

As for the distribution, there are about 600 decorated tombs across Japan, more than half of which, 340 tombs are in Kyushu region, 100 in Kanto region, 50 in Sanin region, 40 in Kinki region, about 40 in Tohoku region and the rest of them are sparsely in seven prefectures.

As for the distribution, there are about 600 decorated tombs across Japan, more than half of which, 340 tombs are in Kyushu region, 100 in Kanto region, 50 in Sanin region, 40 in Kinki region, about 40 in Tohoku region and the rest of them are sparsely in seven prefectures.

sen.j: 古墳時代初期から装飾が施されていた。
sen.e: From the early Kofun period (tumulus period), they were decorated.
They were decorated from the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
They were decorated from the early Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 初期には刳抜式石棺（くりぬきしきせっかん）の側面や蓋の上に、中期には組み合わせ式長持ち石棺の蓋の上面、家形石棺の蓋および棺の内側や外側、箱形石棺にも、そして、5世紀前半頃には横穴式石室にも彫刻や彩色の方法で装飾が施され、さらには石室内全体にまで及んだ。
sen.e: During the early Kofun period the side or cover of coffin were decorated, during the middle period the upper side of cover of combinational large oblong chest stone coffin, the cover and the inner or outer side of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin), box type stone coffin were decorated, and during the early fifth century Yokoanabo cave rock chamber was also decorated with the way of sculpture or coloring and furthermore the whole inside of rock chamber was also decorated.
sen.cmt: 「組み合わせ式長持ち石棺」を、combinational large oblong chest stone coffinとしました。「箱形石棺」を、box type stone coffinとしました。
sen.e: The decorations were made on the side or cover of kurinuki-style (hollowed) stone coffin in the early Kofun period, on the upper side of cover of combinational large oblong chest stone coffin, the cover and the inner or outer side of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin), box type stone coffin in the middle period, and the horizontal stone chamber was decorated with carvings and colors which was done the whole chamber around the early fifth century.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「棺」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「刳抜式石棺」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: The decorations were made on the side or cover of kurinuki-style (hollowed) stone coffin in the early Kofun period, on the upper side of cover of combinational large oblong chest stone coffin, the cover and the inner or outer side of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin), box type stone coffin in the middle period, and the horizontal stone chamber was decorated with carvings and colors which was done the whole chamber around the early fifth century.

sen.j: 装飾方法は、浮き彫り、線刻、彩色の3手法があり、浮き彫りや線刻に彩色するなどの併用手法を用いている。
sen.e: As the way of decoration there were three ways such as relief engraving, line drawing carving and coloring, and the coloring added to the relief engraving or line drawing carving was also concomitantly used.

As the way of decoration there were three ways such as relief engraving, line drawing carving and coloring, and the coloring added to the relief engraving or line drawing carving was also concomitantly used.

As the way of decoration there were three ways such as relief engraving, line drawing carving and coloring, and the coloring added to the relief engraving or line drawing carving was also concomitantly used.

sen.j: 最初期の装飾手法は、彫刻が主流であり、線刻は一部で用いられ、浮き彫りが多く、彩色は赤色顔料だけである。
sen.e: The way of decoration during the earliest period was mainly sculpture and line drawing carving was partly used and relief engraving was often used and the coloring was only with red pigment.
Sculptures were mainstream technique in the earliest period; relief engravings were found in many places while line drawing carving partly and only red pigment was used.
Sculptures were mainstream technique in the earliest period; relief engravings were found in many places while line drawing carving partly and only red pigment was used.

sen.j: 5世紀ごろになると彫刻されたものに赤色以外の色が使用されるようになる。
sen.e: During fifth century colors except for red came to be used for sculptures.
Around fifth century colors other than red came to be used for sculptures.
Around fifth century colors other than red came to be used for sculptures.

sen.j: 6世紀になると浮き彫りを基調とする彫刻がなくなり、基本的には彩色だけで文様が描かれるようになり、石室の壁全体に図柄が描かれるようになる。
sen.e: During sixth century sculptures, mainly relief engraving, disappeared, and basically designs came to be painted only with coloring, and drawing patterns came to be painted on the whole wall of stone chamber.
In sixth century sculptures based on relief engraving disappeared, and basically designs only with color came to be painted on the whole wall of stone chamber.
In sixth century sculptures based on relief engraving disappeared, and basically designs only with color came to be painted on the whole wall of stone chamber.

sen.j: 装飾古墳に描かれた文様には幾何学的・抽象的な直弧文（ちょっこもん）・蕨手文（わらびてもん）・鍵手（かぎのてもん）文・円文・同心円文・連続三角文・菱形文・双脚輪状文（そうきゃくりんじょうもん）・区画文などがあるが、何を表しているのか分からない文である。
sen.e: The designs painted on soshoku kofun were geometric and abstract chokkomon (arc and straight-line pattern), warabite-mon design, kaginote-mon design, en-mon design, doshinen-mon design, renzoku sankaku-mon design, hishigata-mon design, sokyakurinjo-mon design, kukaku-mon design and so on, but these patterns were inscrutable designs.

Following patterns are found in decorated tombs; geometric and abstract chokko-mon (arc and straight-line pattern), warabite-mon (bracken-shaped, scroll-like pattern), kaginote-mon (hook pattern), en-mon (circular pattern), doshinen-mon (concentric pattern), renzoku sankaku-mon (consecutive triangular pattern), hishigata-mon (diamond pattern), sokyakurinjo-mon (circular pattern with two legs), kukaku-mon (vertical running patterns), and so on; however, those are inscrutable.
sen.cmt: 用語補足し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Following patterns are found in decorated tombs; geometric and abstract chokko-mon (arc and straight-line pattern), warabite-mon (bracken-shaped, scroll-like pattern), kaginote-mon (hook pattern), en-mon (circular pattern), doshinen-mon (concentric pattern), renzoku sankaku-mon (consecutive triangular pattern), hishigata-mon (diamond pattern), sokyakurinjo-mon (circular pattern with two legs), kukaku-mon (vertical running patterns), and so on; however, those are inscrutable.

sen.j: 次に、具象的な図柄では盾・靱（ゆぎ）・甲冑・刀・船などの武器・武具・その他の器物や人物・馬・鳥・蟾蜍（ひきがえる）・朱雀などである。
sen.e: Next, concrete designs were the weapon and panoply such as shields, ligaments, armors, swords, ships and so on and the other properties, people, horses, birds,

Next, concrete designs are the weapon and panoply such as shields, ligaments, armors, swords, ships and so on, the other properties, people, horses, birds, hikigaeru (frog), and Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「蟾蜍（ひきがえる）・朱雀」を補足しました。
sen.e: Next, concrete designs are the weapon and panoply such as shields, ligaments, armors, swords, ships and so on, the other properties, people, horses, birds, hikigaeru (frog), and Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix).

sen.j: 4世紀〜7世紀頃に造られ、古墳時代の中では後期に位置する。
sen.e: They were built from fourth century to seventh century and are in the late stage of Kofun period (tumulus period).
They were built from around fourth century to seventh century, the late stage of Kofun period (tumulus period).
They were built from around fourth century to seventh century, the late stage of Kofun period (tumulus period).

tit.e: The list of main soshoku kofun.
The list of major decorated tombs
The list of major decorated tombs

sen.j: 全国で約800基余りがあるとされるが、主なものだけを挙げる。
sen.e: There seem to exist about 800 ones and here are major ones.
Only major decorated tombs are listed as follows while about 800 are said to be in Japan.
Only major decorated tombs are listed as follows while about 800 are said to be in Japan.
